executive_summary: The local refrigerated trucking industry engages frequently with several downstream markets. General retail and groceries make up the largest share of demand. During the period, the retail and grocery segment contributed the most to the demand by far. As the country holed up inside in 2020, consumer demand from the food services industry dropped, while consumer demand for groceries inversely rose. This jump in demand for groceries helped to stave off any further revenue declines related to COVID-19. 2021 led to a strong recovery as in person activities opened up again.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Booming Ecommerce Demand Bolstered Activity for Local
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Ecommerce plays a big role in downstream demand for the industry, as most large grocery stores and big box stores have and online ecommerce presence. Growing ecommerce demand since the early 2010's has benefitted operators, however COVID-19 shutdowns caused an even larger increase in demand since consumers hunkered down inside and avoided outside contact. COVID-19 also acted as a catalyst for heightened ecommerce growth during the period, as a lot of consumers replaced traditional shopping with online, even after the pandemic subsided.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Caused a Dip in Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As the world came to a standstill, overall demand for refrigerated goods shrunk from restaurants and event centers, causing a major slowdown in demand for industry services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Although there was a huge decline in some downstream
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Although there was a huge decline in some downstream markets, it helped the industry through a period of uncertainty. As most consumers remained inside for a year, demand for groceries and other refrigerated goods grew significantly during 2020. Demand for groceries were so high at points during the pandemic that stores were having a difficult time keeping items on shelves. This stock shortage was brought about by panic buying from consumers, effecting essential household and perishable goods. While this was bad for consumers, it meant local refrigerated trucking was in demand during the downturn.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: T H E  I N D U S T R Y  H A S  B E E N  F A C I N G  A  S L E W  O F  N E W  C H A L L E N G E S
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Inflation has surged recently, causing the Federal Reserve to increase interest rates to tame prices. The elevated cost of borrowing has made it more expensive for corporations to borrow money for new office space and other nonresidential structures, hindering demand from construction. Since construction companies are major buyers of local specialized freight trucking, elevated interest rates have hurt the industry. High-interest rates have also threatened consumer demand, creating recessionary fears. These fears have made businesses reluctant to spend, inhibiting spending on local specialized freight trucking. Easing supply chains have reduced energy prices, causing surcharge revenue to decline. Falling gas prices have contributed to the drop in revenue the industry has experienced recently.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rapid advancements in automobile technology and tightening emissions standards are prompting new investments in more efficient, advanced infrastructure and trucks. With the potential introduction of self-driving trucks within the decade, operators will likely reduce workforce investments, leading to slower employment growth. Consequently, trucking companies are expected to invest more capital into a better, more technologically advanced fleet of trucks and logistic software. This shift to automation can aid the industry by boosting operational efficiency, and cutting down both time and cost.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DECLINING OIL PRICES WILL INHIBIT SURCHARGES FOR LOCAL
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Oil and gas prices will subside during the outlook period as energy production ramps up worldwide and supply chain issues related to the pandemic are resolved. Since these prices were abnormally high recently, they encouraged companies to shut down or stop doing business with truckers, causing revenue to fall. Prices that fall from these historic highs will increase business again, boosting revenue. If the prices fall too much, it will reduce surcharge revenue for local specialized freight truckers, hindering revenue and profitability for the industry. While trucking companies have benefited from the drop in energy prices from their historic highs, energy prices will decline precipitously during the outlook period, which will have a negative effect on the industry overall.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FALLING INTEREST RATES ARE SET TO SPUR A BOOST IN
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The end of the previous period was marked by major increases in interest rates as the Federal Reserve tried to slow inflation rates. Heightened interest rates made fleet expansion and replacement much more costly. Which caused dampened expansion and profit growth. Interest rates are expected to be reeled back in during the beginning of the next period, as inflation falls back to a manageable level. Further expansion of fleets, product offerings and scope of business can be expected as a result.

industry_definition: This industry provides local refrigerated trucking services. Products moved by this industry range from meat and poultry to pharmaceuticals and cosmetics, among other goods that require a climate-controlled environment. Goods are typically transported from manufacturers to wholesalers and retailers throughout the country.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Freight transportation services index

key_trends: Food service demand plummeted in 2020. Heightened demand for groceries from stores and ecommerce platforms helped stave off any further declines demand.
Rising interest rates caused demand to falter toward the end of the current period. However, these rate hikes are expected to be temporary and subside in the first few years into the next period.
Local refrigerated truckers are regulated in a variety of ways. They include fuel emissions laws, food safety rules and driving regulations.

Local refrigerated truckers receive assistance from government and private sources. One significant form of aid was Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans during COVID-19, which helped businesses pay for rent and wages.
Grocery stores and food service markets make up the largest portion of downstream demand. Which makes consumer demand incredibly important, and indicative for revenue.
Shifting technology could revolutionize how the industry operates. Both automation and AI are on the horizon for local refrigerated trucking companies.

Becoming a local refrigerated trucker requires little capital, so many small companies are prominent in the industry. This makes it difficult for large operators to gain market share, keeping market share concentration low and internal competition relatively high.
While external competition is low, the industry has a few substitutes. These include rail transport and in-house producers of the industry's Services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The retailers and groceries segment comprises large national, state and local chains. Both retail and grocery stores require a food license, but a retail food store's primary objective may not be selling food.

The food services market segment features several large industries. Food services are businesses or establishments where meals are prepared outside the home. This segment includes restaurants and bars, schools, cafeterias, catering and several other niche industries.

The food processing market segment transforms raw agricultural output into several forms of food. The processed food will then be sent from the processor's plant to retailers, restaurants and grocery stores.

The other market comprises several smaller industries that employ refrigerated trucking. These include pharmaceuticals for transferring blood and temperature-related medication, florists and other smaller industries.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Local Services Make-up the Bulk of Industry Services
products_and_services.product_description: Local services consist of both generalized and specialized freight trucking, providing refrigerated trucking services for a multitude of downstream clients.

Less-than-truckload (LTL) services refer to trucking services that provide a cost-effective way for downstream markets to ship a small amount of freight. Shipments are often paired with orders from several other clients.
The most niche services make up the other segment.

tier_1_suppliers: Ocean & Coastal Transportation in the US
Freight Forwarding Brokerages & Agencies in the US
tier_1_buyers: Truck & Bus Manufacturing in the US
Car & Automobile Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Transportation and Warehousing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: GROWING ECOMMERCE PLATFORMS USE LESS-THAN-TRUCKLOAD SERVICES DURING THE PERIOD
demand_determinants.determinant_description: During this period, an explosion of ecommerce sales has led to an increase in the demand for LTL trucking services. LTL is the most common method for smaller ecommerce platforms to get products out in a cost-efficient way.

basis_points.basis_title: Becoming a local refrigerated trucker requires little capital, so many small companies are prominent in the industry. This makes it difficult for large operators to gain market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Growing interest rates cut into operations
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In the last few years of the period, the Federal Reserve had to engage in contractionary monetary policy to try and slow inflation hikes across the economy.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Heightened energy prices added to volatility
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Companies rely on steady oil prices to set pricing for services, orders among many other operations. So, massive spikes in the price of oil during 2021 and 2022 brought about more volatility for operators.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations. However, a low rate of growth in technology can also create exposure for incumbents as the trajectory of innovation in other markets could lead to unforeseen competitive disadvantages.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Growing interest rates cut into operations
volatility_points.volatility_description: In the last few years of the period, the Federal Reserve had to engage in contractionary monetary policy to try and slow inflation hikes across the economy.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Heightened energy prices added to volatility

FAQs.question: What are the key data points provided in the table?
FAQs.answer: The table provides annual data from 2007 to 2025 (projected) on revenue, IVA (industry value added), number of establishments, enterprises, employment, exports, wages, and domestic demand for an industry. Imports data is missing.
